verses.verse: If I speak with the languages of the people and of the angels, but do not have love, I have become a reverberating piece of copper or a clanging cymbal.
And if I have the skill of preaching and have seen all the secrets and all the information, and if I have all the trust in such a way to be removing mountains, but I don't have love, I am nothing.
And if I use all the things that are mine to give out food, and if I turn in my body so that I might be burned, but I don't have love, I am benefited with nothing.
The love is patient. It is kind. The love is not impassioned. The love does not boast. It is not conceited.
It is not improper. It does not look for its own things. It is not annoyed. It does not consider the bad thing.
It is not happy based on the wrong way, but is happy together with the truth.
All things it puts up with. All things it trusts. All things it anticipates good from. All things it persists to do what is right in.
The love never ever fails, but if there is preaching, it will be rendered useless; if languages, they will stop; if information, it will be rendered useless.
You see, what we know is from a part and what we preach is from a part.
But when the complete thing comes, at that time the thing from a part of it will be rendered useless.

When I was an infant, I was speaking as an infant, I was focusing on things as an infant does, I was considering things as an infant does. But when I have become a man, I have made the things of the infant useless.

You see, now we see through a mirror, in a puzzle, but at that time, face to face. What I know now is from a part, but at that time, I will correctly understand just as I also was correctly understood.
Right now trust, anticipation, love remain, these three. But the greatest of these is the love.
